metadata.Title: CVE-2019-3871 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.Description:
A vulnerability was found in PowerDNS Authoritative Server before 4.0.7 andbefore 4.1.7. An insufficient validation of data coming from the user whenbuilding a HTTP request from a DNS query in the HTTP Connector of theRemote backend, allowing a remote user to cause a denial of service bymaking the server connect to an invalid endpoint, or possibly informationdisclosure by making the server connect to an internal endpoint and somehowextracting meaningful information about the response

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-3871` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

pdns-backend-bind - 4.1.6-3build1
pdns-backend-geoip - 4.1.6-3build1
pdns-backend-ldap - 4.1.6-3build1
pdns-backend-lua - 4.1.6-3build1
pdns-backend-mydns - 4.1.6-3build1
pdns-backend-mysql - 4.1.6-3build1
pdns-backend-odbc - 4.1.6-3build1
pdns-backend-opendbx - 4.1.6-3build1
pdns-backend-pgsql - 4.1.6-3build1
pdns-backend-pipe - 4.1.6-3build1
pdns-backend-remote - 4.1.6-3build1
pdns-backend-sqlite3 - 4.1.6-3build1
pdns-backend-tinydns - 4.1.6-3build1
pdns-server - 4.1.6-3build1
pdns-tools - 4.1.6-3build1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: pdns package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.1.6-3build1').
